title: Big Brother 2020: Gretel Killeen 'signs up to host Seven reboot'
text:
Gretel Killeen is said to have 'signed up to host the Big Brother reboot'.

According to The Sunday Telegraph, TV insiders have revealed the 56-year-old will front the revamped season on Seven which is set to his screens in 2020.

Although this is yet to be confirmed by the network, Gretel fueled rumours herself during an appearance on Weekend Sunrise earlier this month.

She's back! According to The Sunday Telegraph, Gretel Killeen has now 'signed up to host the Big Brother Australia reboot'. Pictured: Gretel hosting Big Brother in 2005

'As if I'm going to tell you that!' she laughed when questioned by host Basil Zempilas, refusing to deny reports that she's 'had discussions' to host the revival.

When asked if she'd 'like' to host the reboot, Gretel continued to deflect and made a joke about her dating life.

After being pressed further, the media personality said: 'I think that is a groundbreaking show.

'As if I'm going to tell you that': Although this is yet to be confirmed by the network, Gretel fueled rumours herself during an appearance on Weekend Sunrise earlier this month

Legend: Gretel hosted Big Brother for seven seasons before being replaced by Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson in 2008. Pictured: Gretel hosting Big Brother in the early 2000s

'I think the way we did it previously was so exciting because you not only never knew what was going to happen but you never knew what I was going to say.'

Gretel hosted Big Brother for seven seasons before being replaced by Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson in 2008.

Last month, former Big Brother winner Reggie Bird warned producers that the upcoming revival of the show will only be successful if Gretel returns as host.

'You've got to have Gretel': Former Big Brother winner Reggie Bird recently backed Gretel to return to the show. Pictured: Gretel and Reggie on Big Brother in 2003

She told News.com.au: 'You've got to have Gretel. She is the mother of Big Brother. If you're going to bring it back you should have Gretel as host and Mike Goldman back doing the voice-overs as well.'

The fly-on-the-wall reality show - which last aired in 2014 on Channel 10 - will be welcoming some major changes when it makes its grand return next year.

Last week, Seven aired a first-look trailer at the 2020 Upfronts - and if the footage is anything to go by, the revamp looks set to be the most intense season to date.

The clip featured footage from many of the international Big Brothers and showed Survivor-like challenges unlike anything the Australian version has seen before.

'The game has changed. The new era begins. New house, new players, new rules,' the trailer caption read.
